info.name: Mantis Bug Tracker REST API
info.description:
Mantis Bug Tracker (MantisHub) REST APIs.

REST API calls have to be authenticated by creating an API token for the user doing the calls, and then passing the API token in the 'Authorization' header. However, for anonymous access, the API key and header are not needed.

Postman Environment Variables:

- token - The API token to be used for authentication.
- url - The base URL for Mantis instance (e.g. '[https://mantisbt'](https://mantisbt') or '[https://instance-name.mantishub.io'](https://instance-name.mantishub.io')).
    

There has been significant improvements and feature additions for REST API in each of the recent releases. Hence, it is highly recommended to use latest release when leveraging the REST APIs.

REST API is enabled by default since MantisBT 2.8.0 release.

item.name: Issues

request.description:
Get issue with the specified id.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.  Issue history included since MantisBT 2.9.0.

response.name: Success

request.description:
Get selected fields for issue with the specified id.

Ability to select fields is available since MantisBT 2.26.0.

response.name: Success

header.value: Apache/2.4.46 (Unix) mod_fastcgi/mod_fastcgi-SNAP-0910052141 PHP/7.4.21 OpenSSL/1.0.2u mod_wsgi/3.5 Python/2.7.18

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

response.name: Success

request.description:
Deletes an issue given its id.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

Have logged in user monitor the specified issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

header.value: Apache/2.4.46 (Unix) mod_fastcgi/mod_fastcgi-SNAP-0910052141 PHP/7.4.21 OpenSSL/1.0.2u mod_wsgi/3.5 Python/2.7.18

request.description:
Have one or more users monitor the specified issue.  The users can be identified via:

- id - their user id.
- name - their username
- email - their email address
- name_or_realname - a string that corresponds to their username or real name.

If user id is not specified, the logged in user id is added to the issue as the monitoring user.

If user id is not the same as logged in user id, a high access level is required which enables adding other users to the monitor list.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

header.value: Apache/2.4.46 (Unix) mod_fastcgi/mod_fastcgi-SNAP-0910052141 PHP/7.4.21 OpenSSL/1.0.2u mod_wsgi/3.5 Python/2.7.18

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.  Attachments supported since MantisBT 2.11.0.

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

Add attachments to an existing issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

item.name: Projects

query.description: The access level code. Will show users with access level greater or equal to this value.
1 to include access level for each user, 0 to skip such information

request.description:
Get users that have access to a project along with their effective project access levels. The list can be filtered by minimum access level where users with such access level or higher will be returned.

The caller must have VIEWER access to the project, otherwise, project doesn't exist error will be returned.

Available since MantisBT 2.26.0.

header.value: Apache/2.4.46 (Unix) mod_fastcgi/mod_fastcgi-SNAP-0910052141 PHP/7.4.21 OpenSSL/1.0.2u mod_wsgi/3.5 Python/2.7.18
Apache/2.4.46 (Unix) mod_fastcgi/mod_fastcgi-SNAP-0910052141 PHP/7.4.21 OpenSSL/1.0.2u mod_wsgi/3.5 Python/2.7.18

item.name: Get Project Users that can be assigned issues

request.description:
Get users that can be assigned issues for a project along with their effective project access levels.

The caller must have VIEWER access to the project, otherwise, project doesn't exist error will be returned.

Available since MantisBT 2.26.0.

header.value: Apache/2.4.46 (Unix) mod_fastcgi/mod_fastcgi-SNAP-0910052141 PHP/7.4.21 OpenSSL/1.0.2u mod_wsgi/3.5 Python/2.7.18

Delete user's access to a project. Note that user may continue to have access to a project based on their global access level if user has an access level higher than `private_project_threshold` config option.

request.description:
Update a set of user attributes. Note that attributes that are not specified will be left unchanged. Hence, it is recommended to only include fields that need to be changed.

To change user's other than user calling the API, the user must have access level greater than or equal to `manage_user_threshold`.

Any user can change their own user attributes excluding `enabled`, `protected`, and `access_level`.

Available since MantisBT 2.26.0.

item.name: Config

request.description:
Get specified config option.  If an option doesn't exist or is marked as private, it will be silently skipped.

Some config options get extra handling to provide more useful response.  For example:

- Enumerations - The enumeration is parsed into an array of objects, each object including id, name and localized label.

For list of possible config options to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/config_defaults_inc.php

When requesting an option, don't supply the `$g_` prefix for the string name.  Only options that are listed as public can be retrieved via this API.  Search the `config_defaults_inc.php` file for `$g_public_config_names` to see the list of public options.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

Get specified config options.  If an option doesn't exist or is marked as private, it will be silently skipped.

Some config options get extra handling to provide more useful response.  For example:

- Enumerations - The enumeration is parsed into an array of objects, each object including id, name and localized label.

For list of possible config options to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/config_defaults_inc.php

When requesting an option, don't supply the `$g_` prefix for the string name.  Only options that are listed as public can be retrieved via this API.  Search the `config_defaults_inc.php` file for `$g_public_config_names` to see the list of public options.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

Sets the specific config options for the specified project (if supplied), otherwise, it will apply to all projects.

For list of possible config options to retrieve see the following file:  
[https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/config_defaults_inc.php](https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/config_defaults_inc.php)

When setting an option, don't supply the `$g_` prefix for the string name. Only options that are listed as public and not globaly only can be set via this API. Search the `config_defaults_inc.php` file for:

- `$g_public_config_names` to see the list of public options.
- `$g_global_settings` to see the list of configs that can only be set via `config_inc.php` and can't be overriden in the database.
    

Available since MantisBT 2.26.0.

item.name: Lang

query.description: The name of the localized string

request.description:
Get the specified localized string.  If string doesn't exist, it will be silently skipped.

For list of possible strings to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/lang/strings_english.txt

When requesting a string, don't supply the `$s_` prefix for the string name.

Get the specified localized strings.  If a string doesn't exist, it will be silently skipped.

For list of possible strings to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/lang/strings_english.txt

When requesting a string, don't supply the `$s_` prefix for the string name.

item.name: Get My User Info with Impersonation

request.description:
This is an example of using user impersonation to access any API while impersonating the desired user. The user whose API token is used must have a global access level that is greater than or equal to `impersonate_user_threshold`.

The `X-Mantis-Username` request header is used to specify the target user to impersonate for the API request. Such user must not have an access level that is greater than the user whose token is passed to the API.

Available since MantisBT 2.26.0
